class_d_02_language_01:
My dear friends! How ARE you all today?
Feeling absolutely fantastic, I hope?[VAR 0114(0026)]
class_d_02_language_02:
It’s time for Salvatore’s Language Lesson!
Êtes-vous prêts—are you ready, everyone?\r
You can answer with “Yes” or “Oui”![VAR 0114(0026)]
class_d_02_language_04:
In our last class, I believe I taught you all how to
say “thank you” in other languages, right?[VAR 0114(0026)]
class_d_02_language_05:
In le cours d’aujourd’hui—today’s class—we will
learn about a certain word sure to make people\r
happy when you use it in your travels abroad![VAR 0114(0026)]
class_d_02_language_06:
What word, you ask? Well, you’ll have to guess!
Délicieux! Hǎochī! Buono! Can anyone tell me\r
what these words mean?[VAR 0114(0026)]
class_d_02_language_answer_01:
Waouh! Correct! C’est super! I knew I could
count on you, [VAR TRNAME(0000)]![VAR 0114(0026)]
class_d_02_language_answer_02:
Oh, [VAR TRNAME(0000)]!\c
If sorry really did “cut it,” as they say, the justice
system would be inutile—unnecessary! Sorry,\r
but that’s a mauvaise réponse—a wrong answer![VAR 0114(0026)]
class_d_02_language_answer_03:
Oh, [VAR TRNAME(0000)]!\c
I hear your SOS! Don’t worry, I’ll SAVE you,
or my name’s not Salvatore! That was a mauvaise\r
réponse—a wrong answer—but I hear you![VAR 0114(0026)]
class_d_02_language_07:
Délicieux! Hǎochī! Buono! All of these words
mean “delicious”![VAR 0114(0026)]
class_d_02_language_08:
Using the local word for “delicious” at markets or
restaurants is sure to get a big sourire—a smile,\r
that is—from whoever you’re talking to![VAR 0114(0026)]
class_d_02_language_09:
It’ll make communication go more smoothly—
I guarantee it![VAR 0114(0026)]
class_d_02_language_10:
People love it when someone says the cuisine of
their homeland is delicious! Who wouldn’t be\r
heureux—happy—to receive such a compliment?[VAR 0114(0026)]
class_d_02_language_11:
And now, apropos of nothing, let me give you
all one of my wise words of advice![VAR 0114(0026)]
class_d_02_language_12:
The first step to smooth communication is to
compliment the person you’re talking to![VAR 0114(0026)]
class_d_02_language_13:
After all, it’s not very likely that a compliment
would put someone in a bad mood![VAR 0114(0026)]
class_d_02_language_14:
This doesn’t only apply to people in other
regions, either! It’s the same for all of you, too!\r
You can put this tip to use with your classmates![VAR 0114(0026)]
class_d_02_language_15:
How about you all try complimenting each other
after class? I bet it will make for an ambiance\r
plus sympathique—a more friendly atmosphere![VAR 0114(0026)]
class_d_02_language_16:
That’s all for today! See you all au prochain
cours—next lesson, that is! Adios! Mata ne![VAR 0114(0026)]
